basics.name: Alfred García
basics.label: Creative Software Engineer
basics.summary: Freelance specialist in software engineering and enthusiastic about the open source and sharing culture. I was born in 1981 and hail from Barcelona. Since I started my career in software development have been programming in diverse fields like web applications, distributed computing, multimedia environments, and artificial intelligence engines. My aim always has been to cultivate new skills, not only in software development. Now I'm investigating about new forms of pedagogy and culture diffusion.

work.summary: Since I finished my Master's degree I have been performing several freelancer tasks on numerous companies. All of these tasks revolve graphics, interactive software, and new technologies like Oculus VR, Unity3D, Android Games, DirectShow, OpenFrameworks, and some web development.

They hired me because I did a DirectShow filter for 360 video streaming when I was freelancer. There I have been developing virtual reality engines, interactive environments, and all kind of graphical stuff.
I helped to develop the first prototype of the application, coding the backend and the client parts in Python and C# respectively. I was promoted to backend leader when the company grew.

I wanted to try the experience of being a college teacher, so after my Master's degree I offered myself as assistant professor in the Computer Science department of Univesity of Barcelona. The subjects that I imparted were: Programming, Software Engineering, and Computer Graphics.

work.company: Autoritat del Transport Metropolità de Barcelona (ATM)
work.summary: I worked on numerous projects based on the public transport field. I used .NET web framework to build software that managed transport data, creating RESTful web services, and applying GIS technologies.
Digital Emotions co. is a currently closed company where I started as junior developer. After few months I got promoted and led the development of an Enterprise Resource Planning software made in C#.

During my apprentice period I collaborated with some companies making some works for them. Those works revolved fields like leisure and management, and were programmed in technologies like Java, ASP4, VBScript, PHP, and VisualBasic 6.

volunteer.summary: Gamestar(t) is a project that brings together art, videogames, and technology. All of these elements are connected using an innovative theory in pedagogy. When I discovered it, I did my best to cooperate with them.

projects.name: 3D scene reconstruction and understanding from single shot pictures
projects.summary: This was my master's degree thesis, a research project which aimed to reconstruct a 3D scene from single shot pictures using a machine learning approach. It was capable of reconstruct those pictures in navigable 3D scenes. It also integrated virtual elements to form an augmented reality scenario.

projects.name: N-bolas
projects.summary: My dissertation for the Computer Science Engineering. It consisted on developing a multimedia framework from scratch, which was used to create a videogame controlled by a computer vision engine.

projects.name: Personal projects
projects.summary: During the course of my career I have used several technologies to implement a large variety of projects for personal use focused on making my everyday tasks easier, they include from server to mobile phone applications.
